titleStmt.title: God fighting for vs in Ireland, or a most true and exact relation of the accurrances [sic] done by the English this moneth last past to this present. With the manner and number of our forces which marched out upon this expedition. Also the names of the castles they tooke, the manner of besieging and of the releasing the English in their deepest destresse, and what number of the Irish was put to the sword. Wherein it apperes that God never forsakes those that puts their trust in him. Written by W.B. of Dublin, whose letters have hitherto expressed nothing but truth.
titleStmt.author: W. B., of Dublin.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for W.B. and are to be sold by Thomas Bates in the Old-Baily,

notesStmt.note: Parts of this work are dated June 16, 17, and 18 respectively.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
